title: 'You are groomed to work to a retirement date'
description: An insurer calls for a more flexible approach to the state pension after running "mid-life MOTs" for staff.

title: US schoolboy lifted off floor in police chokehold
description: The support resource officer at a high school in Arkansas is under investigation for use of excessive force.

title: 'Worried' Fury will be having sleepless nights before rematch - Wilder
description: Deontay Wilder believes Tyson Fury is scared and will be having sleepless nights before their world heavyweight title rematch later this month.

title: Aberdeen win at Hamilton to go third in Scottish Premiership
description: Aberdeen find the net in the league for the first time this calendar year to beat Hamilton and move into third in the Scottish Premiership.

title: Badger falls through Northampton Superdrug shop ceiling
description: The animal was rescued from under the perfume counter of a Superdrug store in Northampton.

title: Coronavirus: China and the virus that threatens everything
description: With the country reeling from the massive public health disaster, what might it mean for the economy, society and those in power?

title: Jamaica deportation: Home Office flight leaves UK despite court ruling
description: A plane carrying 17 convicted offenders takes off but a court order stops 25 others being deported.

title: Falling ice causes first Queensferry Crossing closure
description: It has led to lengthy tailbacks as motorists take a 35-mile diversion across the Kincardine Bridge.

title: Tourists in trainers rescued in Ben Nevis blizzard
description: Mountain rescuers said the weather on the mountain was "horrendous" with a wind chill of about -20C.

title: Coronavirus: UK businessman linked to China virus cases speaks out
description: Steve Walsh, linked to 11 cases in the UK, France and Majorca, says his thoughts are with other patients.

title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2019 nominees to be revealed
description: The BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2020 nominees will be revealed on Wednesday - you can vote for your favourite on the BBC Sport website.

title: UK economy saw zero growth at the end of 2019
description: Growth in the services and construction sectors was offset by a "poor showing" from manufacturing.

title: HS2: Government to give high-speed rail line the go-ahead
description: The rising cost of the project and accusations of mismanagement have provoked anger from critics.

title: Peter Phillips: Queen's grandson and his wife to divorce
description: Peter Phillips and his wife Autumn say their separation is best for their two daughters.

title: 'She was beautiful, funny - and she scammed me'
description: One man tells of how he was tricked in a romance scam as banks warn £8m was lost by victims in six months.

title: Time-lapse as snowstorm hits Turkish coast
description: Footage shows the storm sweeping across the Black Sea and hitting the town of Hopa.

title: Government to pledge £5bn for bus services and cycling routes
description: Boris Johnson says the money will improve bus services - but Labour calls the plan "unambitious".

title: Nanny McPhee actor Raphael Coleman dies
description: Raphael Coleman who starred in the film Nanny McPhee has died, after collapsing, at 25.

title: Lyra McKee murder: Four men arrested in Derry
description: The 29-year-old journalist was observing rioting in Londonderry when she was shot last April.

title: Irish general election: Who will be the next prime minister?
description: BBC News NI's Jayne McCormack assesses how a government might be formed in the Republic of Ireland.

title: 'HS2 has completely wrecked our lives'
description: A Yorkshire couple are being forced to leave their home on the HS2 route which is due to be demolished.

title: 'I'm so mad' - Bryant's widow 'refusing to accept' deaths of husband and daughter
description: Kobe Bryant's widow Vanessa says her "brain refuses to accept" the deaths of her husband and their daughter Gianna.

title: Young photographers use portraits to explore the world they live in
description: A new exhibition features the work of London photographers aged 16 to 19.

title: Man Utd ask permission to install rail seating at Old Trafford
description: Manchester United have asked for permission to install rail seating for up to 1,500 fans at Old Trafford.

title: Greta Thunberg: Climate activist gets her own TV series
description: The teenage climate activist has signed up to take part in a new BBC series about the environment.

title: Oscars 2020: Next moves for the winning stars
description: Once the glitter dust of victory settles, it'll be back to work as usual for the star Oscar winners.

title: The Papers: Royal couple 'separate' and £5bn for local buses
description: Tuesday's papers report on Peter Phillips relationship and new investment for buses and cycle lanes.

title: Ireland elections: Busting five myths
description: The BBC's Larissa Kennelly takes a look at what the results in the Republic of Ireland actually mean.

title: The Smiths' producer shares his hit-making secrets
description: Stephen Street talks Morrissey, Marr and more ahead of being honoured by his peers at the MPG Awards.

title: Oxford University Museum of Natural History gives exhibits fresh look
description: The natural world specimens are being temporarily removed to make way for new display cabinets.

title: 'Why I'm getting teenagers into birdwatching'
description: Mya Bambrick has been a wildlife photographer since she was seven years old.

title: Daniel arap Moi: How Kenyans learnt to laugh at the president
description: Ex-President Moi left a mixed legacy but Kenyans learnt to laugh at his dictatorial excesses.

title: Parasite: What the Oscar win means for Korean cinema
description: The film, directed by Bong Joon-ho, is the first non-English language film to take the top prize.

title: EU fishing rules: Did the UK throw away a million tonnes of fish?
description: Owen Paterson MP said an EU policy meant fish were thrown dead back into the water.

title: Wild swimming: Swansea man's cold sea challenge 'to get out of bed'
description: Josh Pike has been joined by groups of strangers on his year of sunrise swims - and a friendly seal.

title: Syria War: Why is Idlib back in the news?
description: The BBC's Paul Adams explains what has caused this latest humanitarian crisis in north-west Syria.

title: Cirque du Soleil: I've achieved 'extreme flexibility'
description: Aleksei Goloborodko tours the world with Cirque du Soleil as a contortionist in the show Luzia.

title: Blockchain: The revolution that hasn't quite happened
description: Blockchain was hyped as a secure and cheap way to store or retrieve data, but it is yet to take off.

title: Liverpool's Adrian on Jurgen Klopp, the Anfield dressing room, & landing on your feet
description: Last July, Adrian was training alone on local pitches in the south of Spain. In August he made his debut for European champions Liverpool.

title: The dividing lines over Scotland's gender laws
description: Government proposals to make it easier to legally change gender have generated passion, discomfort and even anger.
